Ruby 3.1.1 Ruby 3.1.0 Internals YJIT: New experimental in-process JIT compiler (experimental) Added debug gem: A new debugger Added error_highlight: Fine-grained error location in backtrace Added IRB Autocomplete and Documentation Display Updated Values in Hash literals and keyword arguments can be omitted. Updated Updates in RBS / TypeProf Ruby 3.0 Ruby 3.0.4 CVE CVE-2022-28738: Double free in Regexp compilation.. CVE CVE-2022-28739: Buffer overrun in String-to-Float conversion.. CVE CVE-2021-32066: A StartTLS stripping vulnerability in Net::IM.. CVE CVE-2021-31799: A command injection vulnerability in RDoc.. Ruby 3.0.1 CVE CVE-2021-28965: XML round-trip vulnerability in REXML.. CVE CVE-2021-28966: Path traversal in Tempfile on Windows.. Ruby 3.0.0 Internals MJIT improvements Added Ractor - Actor-model like concurrent abstraction (experimental) Added Fiber Scheduler for light-weight concurrency (experimental) Added RBS - a language to describe the structure of Ruby classes Added TypeProf - type analysis tool, generates RBS type signatures (experimental) Added Hash#except Updated Keyword arguments are separated from other arguments Updated Rightward assignment statement Updated Reversed (again) order of backtrace (experimental) Updated Endless method definition def square(x) = x * x Ruby 2.7 Ruby 2.7.6 CVE CVE-2022-28739: Buffer overrun in String-to-Float conversion.. docs.title: Ruby 2.3.0

docs.text: Ruby latest versions Ruby 3.1.2 Internals YJIT: New experimental in-process JIT compiler (experimental) --yjit # CLI option Added debug gem: A new debugger Added error_highlight: Fine-grained error location in backtrace Added IRB Autocomplete and Documentation Display Updated Values in Hash literals and keyword arguments can be omitted. {x:, y:} is syntax sugar for {x: x, y: y} foo(x:, y:) is syntax sugar for foo(x: x, y: y). Updated Updates in RBS / TypeProf Ruby 3.0.4 Internals MJIT improvements Added Ractor - Actor-model like concurrent abstraction (experimental) Added Fiber Scheduler for light-weight concurrency (experimental) Added RBS - a language to describe the structure of Ruby classes class User attr_reader login: String attr_reader email: String def initialize: (login: String, email: String) -> void end Added TypeProf - type analysis tool, generates RBS type signatures (experimental) Added Hash#except Updated Keyword arguments are separated from other arguments def foo(key: 42); end; foo({key: 42}) # won't work! def foo(key: 42); end; foo(**{key: 42}) # OK Updated Rightward assignment statement fib(10) => a a #=> 55 Updated Reversed (again) order of backtrace (experimental) Error message first, caller later. This reverts change from Ruby 2.5.0. Updated Endless method definition def square(x) = x * x Ruby 2.7.6 Added Pattern Matching (experimental) case [0, [1, 2, 3]] in [a, [b, *c]] a # => 0 b # => 1 c # => [2, 3] Updated REPL improvements Updated Separation of positional and keyword arguments // To treat last hash argument as keywords, add a double splat operator // (to avoid the warning and ensure correct behavior in Ruby 3) def foo(key: 42); end; foo({key: 42}) # warned def foo(key: 42); end; foo(**{key: 42}) # OK Updated Argument forwarding // parentheses are mandatory def foo(...) bar(...) end Internals Compaction GC Ruby 2.6.10 Added endless ranges (1..) Added Enumerable#chain Added function composition operators <<, >> to Proc Updated #then alias for #yield_self Internals JIT compiler --jit Internals Bundler is installed as a default gem Ruby 2.5.9 Added yield_self // Unlike #tap, it returns the result of the block. // yield_self is like #map for single object. 'Hello'.yield_self { |word| word.upcase } => 'HELLO' ['Hello'].map { |word| word.upcase }.first => 'HELLO' Added rescue in blocks Added Hash#slice and Hash#transform_keys Added ERB#result_with_hash Updated New Array aliases - #prepend (#unshift) and #append (#push) Updated Pattern argument on Enumerable methods Updated Keyword arguments on Struct.new Updated Removed Top-level constant lookup Updated Reverse order of backtrace (oldest call first) (experimental) Only when printed to terminal directly. This will be reversed again in Ruby 3.0.0 Ruby 2.4.10 Added Enumerable#sum Added Integer#digits Added Regexp#match? , Regexp#named_captures Updated New constructor Logger.new(STDOUT, level:, progname:) Updated Float: #round , #ceil , #floor , and #truncate now accept a precision Removed Removed Fixnum and Bignum classes (unified to Integer ) Ruby 2.3.8 Added Safe navigation operator &. Added Frozen string literals Added Array#dig Added Hash#fetch_values , Hash#to_proc , Hash#dig Added 'Did you mean?' Ruby 2.2 Removed callcc is obsolete - use Fiber instead Removed DL has been removed from stdlib - use Fiddle instead Internals Incremental GC - fixes performance for 'old' objects Internals The introduction of GC for symbols (mortal/immortal) Ruby 2.1 Added Refinements Added Exception#cause - for libraries exceptions Added Rational and Complex literals Added Generational GC - young / old objects Ruby 2.0 Added Keyword arguments Added Module#prepend Added Enumerator#lazy Added %i a literal for symbol array (Last updated on 2022-04-29 23:08:04 +0200)
docs.title: Latest Versions

docs.text: Internals YJIT: New experimental in-process JIT compiler (experimental) --yjit # CLI option Added debug gem: A new debugger Added error_highlight: Fine-grained error location in backtrace Added IRB Autocomplete and Documentation Display Updated Values in Hash literals and keyword arguments can be omitted. {x:, y:} is syntax sugar for {x: x, y: y} foo(x:, y:) is syntax sugar for foo(x: x, y: y). Updated Updates in RBS / TypeProf
docs.title: Ruby 3.1.2

docs.text: Internals MJIT improvements Added Ractor - Actor-model like concurrent abstraction (experimental) Added Fiber Scheduler for light-weight concurrency (experimental) Added RBS - a language to describe the structure of Ruby classes class User attr_reader login: String attr_reader email: String def initialize: (login: String, email: String) -> void end Added TypeProf - type analysis tool, generates RBS type signatures (experimental) Added Hash#except Updated Keyword arguments are separated from other arguments def foo(key: 42); end; foo({key: 42}) # won't work! def foo(key: 42); end; foo(**{key: 42}) # OK Updated Rightward assignment statement fib(10) => a a #=> 55 Updated Reversed (again) order of backtrace (experimental) Error message first, caller later. This reverts change from Ruby 2.5.0. Updated Endless method definition def square(x) = x * x
docs.title: Ruby 3.0.4

docs.text: Added Pattern Matching (experimental) case [0, [1, 2, 3]] in [a, [b, *c]] a # => 0 b # => 1 c # => [2, 3] Updated REPL improvements Updated Separation of positional and keyword arguments // To treat last hash argument as keywords, add a double splat operator // (to avoid the warning and ensure correct behavior in Ruby 3) def foo(key: 42); end; foo({key: 42}) # warned def foo(key: 42); end; foo(**{key: 42}) # OK Updated Argument forwarding // parentheses are mandatory def foo(...) bar(...) end Internals Compaction GC
docs.title: Ruby 2.7.6

docs.text: Added endless ranges (1..) Added Enumerable#chain Added function composition operators <<, >> to Proc Updated #then alias for #yield_self Internals JIT compiler --jit Internals Bundler is installed as a default gem
docs.title: Ruby 2.6.10

docs.text: Added yield_self // Unlike #tap, it returns the result of the block. // yield_self is like #map for single object. 'Hello'.yield_self { |word| word.upcase } => 'HELLO' ['Hello'].map { |word| word.upcase }.first => 'HELLO' Added rescue in blocks Added Hash#slice and Hash#transform_keys Added ERB#result_with_hash Updated New Array aliases - #prepend (#unshift) and #append (#push) Updated Pattern argument on Enumerable methods Updated Keyword arguments on Struct.new Updated Removed Top-level constant lookup Updated Reverse order of backtrace (oldest call first) (experimental) Only when printed to terminal directly. This will be reversed again in Ruby 3.0.0
docs.title: Ruby 2.5.9

docs.text: Added Enumerable#sum Added Integer#digits Added Regexp#match? , Regexp#named_captures Updated New constructor Logger.new(STDOUT, level:, progname:) Updated Float: #round , #ceil , #floor , and #truncate now accept a precision Removed Removed Fixnum and Bignum classes (unified to Integer )
docs.title: Ruby 2.4.10

docs.text: Added Safe navigation operator &. Added Frozen string literals Added Array#dig Added Hash#fetch_values , Hash#to_proc , Hash#dig Added 'Did you mean?'
docs.title: Ruby 2.3.8

docs.text: Removed callcc is obsolete - use Fiber instead Removed DL has been removed from stdlib - use Fiddle instead Internals Incremental GC - fixes performance for 'old' objects Internals The introduction of GC for symbols (mortal/immortal)
docs.title: Ruby 2.2

docs.text: Added Refinements Added Exception#cause - for libraries exceptions Added Rational and Complex literals Added Generational GC - young / old objects

docs.title: Ruby 2.0

docs.text: Ruby latest versions Ruby 2.7.1 Pattern Matching REPL improvements Separation of positional and keyword arguments Compaction GC Ruby 2.6.6 endless ranges (1..) Enumerable#chain function composition operators <<, >> to Proc #then alias for #yield_self JIT compiler --jit Bundler is installed as a default gem Ruby 2.5.8 yield_self - unlike #tap , it returns the result of the block rescue in blocks Hash#slice and Hash#transform_keys ERB#result_with_hash New Array aliases - #prepend (#unshift) and #append (#push) Pattern argument on Enumerable methods Keyword arguments on Struct.new Removed Top-level constant lookup Ruby 2.4.10 All maintenance ended on 2020-03-31. Enumerable#sum Integer#digits Regexp#match? , Regexp#named_captures New constructor Logger.new(STDOUT, level:, progname:) Float: #round , #ceil , #floor , and #truncate now accept a precision Removed Fixnum and Bignum classes (unified to Integer ) Ruby 2.3.8 All maintenance ended on 2019-03-31. Safe navigation operator &. Frozen string literals Array#dig Hash#fetch_values , Hash#to_proc , Hash#dig 'Did you mean?' Ruby 2.2 All maintenance ended on 2018-03-31. callcc is obsolete - use Fiber instead DL has been removed from stdlib - use Fiddle instead Incremental GC - fixes performance for 'old' objects The introduction of GC for symbols (mortal/immortal) Ruby 2.1 All maintenance ended on 2017-03-31. Refinements Exception#cause - for libraries exceptions Rational and Complex literals Generational GC - young / old objects Ruby 2.0 All maintenance ended on 2016-02-24. Keyword arguments Module#prepend Enumerator#lazy %i a literal for symbol array (This page was updated on 2020-09-04 21:29:03 +0200)
